  • Short, Long, Orbit, System and Pulse variants exists and work the same way, but with ranges and cost increases equivalent to communicators.

Holograph - Pulse function.name: Holograph - Pulse function
Holograph - Pulse function.description:
The holograph can transmit and receive holographic messages. The holograms are detailed enough to show tiny text and detailed pictures, and can for example be used to see through a disguise. Three-dimensional floor plans and maps can also be transmitted.

  • Personal: Holograph for short distance communication, about 10 kilometers. Usually designed as a wristband or a @Item[Tabula].
  • Short, Long, Orbit, System and Pulse variants exists and work the same way, but with ranges and cost increases equivalent to communicators.

Holograph - Short Range.name: Holograph - Short Range
Holograph - Short Range.description:
The holograph can transmit and receive holographic messages. The holograms are detailed enough to show tiny text and detailed pictures, and can for example be used to see through a disguise. Three-dimensional floor plans and maps can also be transmitted.

  • Personal: Holograph for short distance communication, about 10 kilometers. Usually designed as a wristband or a @Item[Tabula].
  • Short, Long, Orbit, System and Pulse variants exists and work the same way, but with ranges and cost increases equivalent to communicators.

Holograph - System.name: Holograph - System
Holograph - System.description:
The holograph can transmit and receive holographic messages. The holograms are detailed enough to show tiny text and detailed pictures, and can for example be used to see through a disguise. Three-dimensional floor plans and maps can also be transmitted.

  • Personal: Holograph for short distance communication, about 10 kilometers. Usually designed as a wristband or a @Item[Tabula].
  • Short, Long, Orbit, System and Pulse variants exists and work the same way, but with ranges and cost increases equivalent to communicators.

Hyper rope.name: Hyper rope
Hyper rope.description: A thin and incredibly strong rope that is 50 meters long. Can be fastened to most materials. Cannot be climbed without special hand and foot grips as the rope cuts like a knife. The grips are included. Gives a +1 to dexterity when climbing.

Inferno grenade.name: Inferno grenade
Inferno grenade.description: The grenade detonates with a very powerful but concentrated explosion.

Intelligent.name: Intelligent
Intelligent.description: Your brain’s bio code and cognitive pathways have been altered to make you cold and logical. You get a +1 to all science and technology tests, but a -2 to manipulation.

Internal Bleeding.name: Internal Bleeding
Internal Bleeding.description: Unconscious [[/roll d6]] hours, then 1 point of damage per force, dexterity, or melee combat test.

Intimidating.name: Intimidating
Intimidating.description: You can test force instead of manipulation when you are threatening someone. If you achieve a limited success, you don’t have to accept your opponent’s conditional demand – your opponent may then refuse the deal, but if she does, she must immediately attack you.

Intuition.name: Intuition
Intuition.description: You get to ask the GM a simple yes/no question about anything in the game world. He must answer truthfully “yes”, “no” or “maybe”. The GM can answer “maybe” even if he knows the answer, if he thinks answering yes or no would upset the game too much. Please note that neither truths nor lies are universal – it depends on who is asking. Opinions, morals and worldviews can make something true to someone and false to someone else.

Ion Cannon.name: Ion Cannon
Ion Cannon.description: A cannon firing beams of ionizing radiation. Deals equal damage to both systems and hull.

Ion Missile.name: Ion Missile
Ion Missile.description: A missile that on impact delivers a powerful ionized discharge. Deals equal damage to both systems and hull.

Ion Torpedo.name: Ion Torpedo
Ion Torpedo.description: A torpedo with an ionized warhead. Deals equal damage to both systems and hull.

Jet pack.name: Jet pack
Jet pack.description: A jet system worn as a backpack enabling rocket flight for one person. Works best in zero-G (+2 to dexterity) but can be used in gravity as well, although with weaker speed and thrust (+1 to dexterity). Must be refueled after one hour of flight.

Judge of Character.name: Judge of Character
Judge of Character.description: You can tell if someone is lying or telling the truth without testing manipulation. It takes about a minute and you can’t tell any details, only whether the person is lying or not. Half-truths also read as lies. Each use gives the GM 1 DP.

Kambra.name: Kambra
Kambra.description: A drug that induces a state of euphoria, making the user charismatic and happy (+1 to manipulation) for a few hours, followed by a bad day of hangover. The user suffers 2 points of stress per use.

Lacerated Kidney.name: Lacerated Kidney
Lacerated Kidney.description: Stunned for two turns, then 1 point of damage per force, dexterity, or melee combat test.

Language Modulator.name: Language Modulator
Language Modulator.description: Your larynx and vocal chords have been replaced with a sound modulator and an interpreter unit. You can automatically translate your speech to another language if you speak slowly. The modulator supports up to five different language packs. See @Item[Language Unit] in Chapter 6.

Language Unit.name: Language Unit
Language Unit.description: The language unit is worn as a heavy medallion around one’s neck. If the wearer speaks slowly, clearly and with pauses, the unit provides real-time translation to another language. The unit can hold software for three different languages. Tags with language software cost half the price of the unit.

Last Laugh.name: Last Laugh
Last Laugh.description: You can get yourselves out of a pinch using your knack for entertainment. The GM gets 1 DP per use. One use per session for the whole group (not once per PC).

Legionnaire carbine Dayal-3.name: Legionnaire carbine Dayal-3
Legionnaire carbine Dayal-3.description: A carbine produced and used by the Legion. Comes with a built-in grenade launcher, Advanced recoil dampeners and an extra-large drum magazine.

Library Database.name: Library Database
Library Database.description: A database giving you a +3 to culture or science within one defined area, for example astronics, humanities or artifacts.

Library Database (I).name: Library Database (I)
Library Database (I).description: A specialized library database is an encyclopedia of information relating to a specific, usually narrow, topic. It is used via a ship computer or ship djinn to gain a bonus to science or culture, between +1 and +3 depending on how narrow the subject is.

Library Database (II).name: Library Database (II)
Library Database (II).description: A specialized library database is an encyclopedia of information relating to a specific, usually narrow, topic. It is used via a ship computer or ship djinn to gain a bonus to science or culture, between +1 and +3 depending on how narrow the subject is.

Licensed.name: Licensed
Licensed.description: You have the proper licenses to buy restricted gear and weapons (Chapter 6). You can purchase the items if you can afford them, and if they are available at your location. Being licensed is not the same as being permitted to carry all kinds of weaponry in public, however. Local regulations can still stop you from carrying weapons you are allowed to own.

Lie Detector.name: Lie Detector
Lie Detector.description: You have a built-in lie detector. To use it on someone, you must touch the person, speak to her, and look her in the eyes. Test manipulation with a +2 (not an opposed roll). If you pass, you can tell if the person is lying or not.

Lie detector.name: Lie detector
Lie detector.description: A small box with wires that when connected to someone who is being questioned can help the interrogator tell if the subject is telling the truth or not (+2 to manipulation).

Limited Decompression.name: Limited Decompression
Limited Decompression.description: The integrity of the bridge or some other populated module is breached, venting oxygen into space. Roll a die at the beginning of each following turn – on a six, the module suffers complete explosive decompression (page 99). The engineer can repair the breach in the engineer phase.

Loader exo.name: Loader exo
Loader exo.description: An exo reinforced with heavy-duty servos designed for heavy lifting and loading. The wearer can lift up to 500 kilograms without problems (+2 to force) but the exo is slow to maneuver which makes it unfit for melee combat. The loader exo is otherwise treated as a normal exo shell.

M-dose.name: M-dose
M-dose.description: A one-use injector for stabilizing wounds or treating poison, disease or radiation damage. Called “life insurance” or “first aid” in soldier slang, although the Legionnaires are of the belief that one’s carbine is the first aid, instead referring to the m-dose as the “fuse” or the “last aid”. An m-dose should be used together with a @Item[Medkit]; on its own it only gives a +1 to medicurgy.

Machinegunner.name: Machinegunner
Machinegunner.description: Firing full-auto is the only way to get the job done, in your opinion. Ignore the first 1 when rolling for automatic fire (page 89). Firing a weapon with the High Capacity feature, you get to ignore the first two 1s.

Malicious.name: Malicious
Malicious.description: When you successfully use manipulation on someone and inflict at least 1 point of stress, she takes 1 additional point of stress.

Mechanical lockpick.name: Mechanical lockpick
Mechanical lockpick.description: A lockpick for mechanical locks. Gives no bonus to technology, but with improvised tools instead of a lockpick, the user gets a -1.

Medkit.name: Medkit
Medkit.description: Ordinary bag of medicurgical supplies for treating wounds, poisonings, radiation damage or severe illness. Contains a diagnostic unit, suture gun, pneumatic needles, bandages and other basic gear, as well as 10 m-doses. The medkit gives a +2 to medicurgy. Bonuses from medical equipment do not stack – use only the highest bonus.

Medlab.name: Medlab
Medlab.description: The medlab is a module used when treating wounds. Read more in Chapter 5.

Mercy of the Icons.name: Mercy of the Icons
Mercy of the Icons.description: When you are in a tight spot, the Icons will hear you. This means that you can cancel the effects of Darkness Points that have just been spent by the GM (Chapter 3). One use per session for the whole group (not once per PC).

Meson Cannon.name: Meson Cannon
Meson Cannon.description: A cannon that fires disruptor beams. Ignores the effects of armor.

Mind Reader.name: Mind Reader
Mind Reader.description: You can read someone else’s thoughts for a minute or so. You can only read surface thoughts; you can’t dig for any deeper memories. Your target must be within Close Range.

Mind Walker.name: Mind Walker
Mind Walker.description: If you focus your thoughts on a person you have previously met, you can tap into that person’s sensory input. You experience what that person sees, hears and feels in that exact moment, regardless of where in the Horizon she is. No thoughts or emotions are transmitted.

Mind-enhancing narcotics.name: Mind-enhancing narcotics
Mind-enhancing narcotics.description: These drugs come in a variety of forms and with many different effects. They can be ingested, injected or applied as adhesive patches. The effects are very strong – one attribute is raised by 1 for [[/roll d6]] hours. The drugs come with serious fatigue after the high, however. When the PC comes down, she suffers 2 points of damage and a -1 to the affected attribute for half a day.

Mining Station.name: Mining Station
Mining Station.description: This module is a necessity for a crew who wants to prospect for valuable gases and minerals. It contains drills, ore nets, some smaller magnet trawls and equipment for the crew – handheld drills, vibro picks, and pry bars for manual labor. To store the findings, you need a cargo hold.

Modulation mask.name: Modulation mask
Modulation mask.description: A necklace that projects a modulated image in front of the wearer’s face. This makes it easier to disguise oneself. Opponents get a -2 to observation to see through the ruse.

Modulator.name: Modulator
Modulator.description: A communicator based on modulation – nanotechnological representation of real objects. Has the performance of a personal com (10 kilometers) and can both transmit and receive perfect copies of objects and people. The modulated object is tied to the plate-shaped modulator and cannot be moved, but can be touched and turned as long as it stays above the unit. The copied objects lack the functions of the originals, but their weight and appearance are perfect down to the molecular level.

Moisture condenser.name: Moisture condenser
Moisture condenser.description: Gathers and condenses moisture from the surrounding air. In a normal climate, the unit can produce enough water for two people per day, in a humid climate the water is enough for five people and in an arid climate, such as deserts or tundra, it is enough for one person. The water is automatically purified. Powered by a @Item[Cell] that needs changing once a week.

Morph.name: Morph
Morph.description:
Your body is sculpted so that your entire physiognomy is changed – you could have anything from wings to extra limbs. This gives you obvious benefits, but could trigger fear and disgust among common people, or even hate among fanatics. Your Reputation is lowered by 2. See the boxed text on the opposite page for a list of known morphs (@JournalEntry[Known Morphs]).

Cost: between 30,000 and 60,000 birr.

Musical Instrument.name: Musical Instrument
Musical Instrument.description: The Third Horizon contains many different musical instruments, from Primitive flutes and drums to Ordinary cirras, harps and chordophones. Gives a +1 to manipulation if used for entertainment purposes. The GM has final say on when this bonus is applicable.

Nestera Mangler.name: Nestera Mangler
Nestera Mangler.description: An accelerator cannon with a high rate of fire and explosive slugs for very high damage.

Night sights.name: Night sights
Night sights.description: A light-sensitive scope that lets the shooter use her weapon in darkness without penalties.

Nimble.name: Nimble
Nimble.description: Your bionically enhanced nerves give you amazing agility. You get a +2 to dexterity for acrobatic feats and gymnastic maneuvers. The modifier also applies to dance and other physical activities.

Nine Lives.name: Nine Lives
Nine Lives.description: No matter how bad it looks, you always seem to come out of situations alive. When you suffer a critical injury, you get to switch the dice – turning the tens digit into the ones and vice versa (page 94). If your attacker has the talent @Item[Executioner], the effects neutralize each other – roll the critical injury normally.

Nuclear Mine.name: Nuclear Mine
Nuclear Mine.description: A mine with a nuclear warhead. The detonation deals damage to all ships within Contact range of the blast.

Nuclear Torpedo.name: Nuclear Torpedo
Nuclear Torpedo.description: A torpedo with a nuclear warhead. The detonation deals damage to all ships within Contact range of the blast.

Nutrition pills.name: Nutrition pills
Nutrition pills.description: One’s daily need of energy and nutrition compressed into three tiny pills, usually fruit or berry flavored and designed to provide the user with a sense of being full. Must be taken with at least half a liter of water or they will cause serious stomach pains and massive constipation.

Nutrition recycler.name: Nutrition recycler
Nutrition recycler.description: Biomolecular de- or reconstruction technology that processes waste and turns it into food. Used by expeditions, long-haul freighters or in prison camps to recycle all organic waste into nutritious (if foul-tasting) food. For both taste and associative reasons, the end product is appreciated by very few. Powered by the reactor if on a ship or by a fusion battery if in a camp or ground vehicle. Produces enough disgusting food per day to feed six people.

Obvious Signature.name: Obvious Signature
Obvious Signature.description: The hull reflects radiation, making it easy to spot on sensors. When the problem is activated, all opponents get a +2 to their data djinn rolls to detect the ship.

One Last Birr.name: One Last Birr
One Last Birr.description: You can make a living out of your craft or performances. Test dexterity instead of manipulation to find basic subsistence (food, drink, repairs – no new gear) when in a new place.

Opor.name: Opor
Opor.description: Synthetic arrash, stronger and more addictive. Usually smoked in long pipes or burned on a plate, with the smoke being inhaled under a rag. Can also be injected. Gives the user a powerful high and -2 to all skills.

Optical scope.name: Optical scope
Optical scope.description: A scope that provides the shooter with an enlarged view of the target and a crosshair for firing reference. Makes it easier to hit with firearms (+1 to ranged combat) at Long range and above. Requires an aimed shot (page 88). Can also be used as @Item[Binoculars] when scouting.

P-dose.name: P-dose
P-dose.description: The p-dose is the Order of the Pariah’s version of a regular @Item[M-dose]. It is more potent but hard to come by, even in the places where it isn’t illegal. It is used like an @Item[M-dose] but gives a +2 to the medicurgy roll when treating normal injuries and a +3 when treating critical injuries.

Passive Sensors.name: Passive Sensors
Passive Sensors.description: Passive sensors are implanted in your body. You can use them like the passive mode on a personal sensor whenever you wish. Details for personal sensors are found in Chapter 6.

Pheromones.name: Pheromones
Pheromones.description: You have the ability to transmit and receive pheromones via enlarged dermal glands on your chest, neck or face. Your pheromones spread through air and will not work in a vacuum or affect people in exos. The pheromones make others obey you – you get a +2 to manipulation. One use per session.

Pierced Heart.name: Pierced Heart
Pierced Heart.description: Your heart beats one final time. Create a new PC.

Pierced Intestines.name: Pierced Intestines
Pierced Intestines.description: Stunned for one turn, then 1 point of damage per hour until first aid is administered.

Plasma Torpedo.name: Plasma Torpedo
Plasma Torpedo.description: A torpedo with a plasma warhead. Reduces the Armor Rating of the enemy ship by 1 until repairs are made.

Point Blank.name: Point Blank
Point Blank.description: When you shoot someone and hit, you automatically add an extra six to your roll – but only if you attack from Close Range.

Poison.name: Poison
Poison.description: A poison that can be applied to a weapon, eaten or injected. Common poisons have a strength of between 1 and 5, but strong ones could have a strength of up to 8. The poison attack is an opposed poison strength vs attribute roll (which attribute to test depends on which kind of poison it is). If the victim fails, she suffers damage or stress equal to the poison strength. If she wins the roll, she suffers only passing symptoms (-1 to the relevant attribute for [[/roll d6]] hours.)

Portable laboratory.name: Portable laboratory
Portable laboratory.description: A portable lab unit that can be used for most analyses. Comes with bio, rad, chem and spectral sensors. Gives a +2 to science when analyzing foreign substances and objects.

Precise Thrusters.name: Precise Thrusters
Precise Thrusters.description: The thrusters have been fitted with brand new magnet flux cores and nanite membranes. Nimble and easy to maneuver, the ship gains a +2 to docking, landing and evasion (see Space Combat).

Prediction.name: Prediction
Prediction.description: If you conduct a séance, you can experience powerful visions of the future. You ask the GM questions about yourself or someone else taking part in the séance. The GM answers as best he can. The answers should be short, preferably mysterious and ambiguous. An answer could also take the form of an omen, a sign of fortune or tragedy waiting around the corner.

Premonition.name: Premonition
Premonition.description: In some mysterious way, you can sense impending danger. The GM will have you test Mystic Powers – if you pass, you get a feeling of a looming threat, but no details about what it might be.

Pressure tent.name: Pressure tent
Pressure tent.description: A four-person tent that regulates pressure and gas levels to make the inside atmosphere pleasurable to humans. Comes with enough oxygen for four people in a completely oxygen-free environment for one day. In low-oxygen surroundings, the oxygen will last proportionately longer. If the tent absorbs some oxygen from the surrounding atmosphere, harmful substances are filtered out.

Proximity sensor.name: Proximity sensor
Proximity sensor.description:
The proximity sensor scans several spectra of the surroundings and displays detailed live information about terrain, vehicles and even individual persons in the area. The information is not exact enough to identify someone or to make out more about a vehicle than type and model. The sensor has two modes:

  • Active mode: This mode covers Extreme Range in open terrain and forests. Hidden objects and threats require a skilled sensor operator to spot. The sensor allows the operator to test technology to find hidden things in her surroundings. When the sensor is in active mode, it is easy (+2) to discover it using other sensor tech.
  • Passive mode: This mode has Long Range but is less risky to the user as it won’t reveal the user’s location (no bonus to technology to spot the sensor user).

Proxy helmet.name: Proxy helmet
Proxy helmet.description: A hood, helmet or some other headdress allowing the wearer to experience other people’s recorded brain activity.

Proxy trip.name: Proxy trip
Proxy trip.description: A proxy experience from the streets, rarely morally acceptable but always very strong. Long term use is very addictive. The user becomes distracted and gets a -2 to observation for the duration of the trip. Requires a proxy helmet to be used.

Punctured Lung.name: Punctured Lung
Punctured Lung.description: Stunned for one turn, then -3 to dexterity.

Quick.name: Quick
Quick.description: Your muscles are bionically altered for incredibly explosive speed, making you a fast runner. Your Movement Rate is increased by 4 meters (can be combined with @Item[Sprinter] but not with @Item[Cybernetic Muscles]). You can jump 5 meters horizontally from standing still, 15 meters with a running start (slow action), and 2 meters vertically.

Quickest Route.name: Quickest Route
Quickest Route.description: You find the quickest route. Travel takes half the amount of time (page 138), or one encounter along the way may be ignored. The GM gets 1 DP per use. One use per journey.

Rapid Reload.name: Rapid Reload
Rapid Reload.description: You can reload a weapon as a fast action, rather than as a normal one (page 83).

Reactor.name: Reactor
Reactor.description: Almost all ships in the Third Horizon use hydrogen based fusion reactors to power their engines. Each ship class has its own reactor size. There are features that increase reactor output.

Reactor Burst.name: Reactor Burst
Reactor Burst.description: The reactor can be pushed to its very limits, giving an automatic 3 extra EP when overloading the reactor (page 168), plus any EP from sixes on the roll. The ship takes 2 points of hull damage from this, regardless of whether the roll succeeded or not.

Reactor Detonation.name: Reactor Detonation
Reactor Detonation.description: A critical hit in the reactor is the worst possible outcome. Reactors in the Third Horizon generate enormous amounts of energy, and a critical hit in the reactor releases all this energy at once. The effect is disastrous – the ship is broken apart and lost forever. Everyone onboard risks serious damage (see the boxed text), and are of course subjected to immediate explosive decompression.

Recon probe.name: Recon probe
Recon probe.description: A probe used to scout out the surrounding area. It hovers thanks to a small grav unit. Powered by a @Item[Cell] that needs changing after two hours of use. The probe can be remote controlled from up to Extreme Range. The operator’s observation score is tested to determine how detailed the probe’s observations are.

Regenerate.name: Regenerate
Regenerate.description: You heal fast, and recover remarkably quickly even from grave injuries. The time to heal a critical injury (page 94) is halved. You also get 2 extra Hit Points.

Reload, Advanced.name: Reload, Advanced
Reload, Advanced.description: Advanced ammunition is completely cell-based. An Advanced magazine can be recharged at a charging station for 50 birr. Normal, “civilian” cells cannot be used in weapons as they require specially made versions.

Reload, Ordinary.name: Reload, Ordinary
Reload, Ordinary.description: Ordinary reloads are usually magazines or single missiles or grenades. If the weapon requires a @Item[Cell], this is built into the magazine. All weapons that use magazines have the weight of a full magazine included in the listed weight of the weapon. For special ammunition, see Weapons below.

Reload, Primitive.name: Reload, Primitive
Reload, Primitive.description: Ammunition for Primitive weapons is easy to manufacture but generally not interchangeable between weapon types, as it could be cartridges, arrows, sling stones, or black powder charges. A Primitive reload could be anything from a magazine of bullets to a handful of arrows. If the weapon has the feature Single-shot (see below), every reload is one unit of ammunition.

Reload, Vibro.name: Reload, Vibro
Reload, Vibro.description: These bullets are vibrating flechettes that cut through the target rather than exploding like normal Vulcan rounds. They are mainly used by hunters who don’t wish to ruin the hides of their kills, but could also be used for assassinations as the rounds make very little sound, giving the weapon the feature Silent (p 133). Vibro ammo is very effective against unarmored targets but has poor armor-piercing capabilities, which makes it safer to use in a firefight onboard a spaceship or space station than regular Vulcan rounds. The shooter gets a +1 to ranged combat, but all targets get a +2 to their Armor Rating.

Remote control module.name: Remote control module
Remote control module.description: A control unit for a computer or tabula that allows for remote control of a vehicle within Extreme Range by testing data djinn.

Research Computer.name: Research Computer
Research Computer.description: The ship computer has been upgraded and now contains tools for measuring. Gives +1 to science when measuring something and analyzing the results. Can be combined with a Library Database.

Resistant.name: Resistant
Resistant.description: Your body can endure extreme weather and other natural hazards. The talent counts as “armor” with an Armor Rating of 6 against natural damage. You can combine @Item[Resistant] with @Item[Rugged], for a total Armor Rating of 9 against natural damage.

Robust Hull.name: Robust Hull
Robust Hull.description: The beams and joints of the hull have been replaced with duralite and smart nanites. Gives +1 Hull Point.

Rugged.name: Rugged
Rugged.description: You are used to extreme weather and other natural hazards (cold, storms, strong gravity, fire, etc.). The talent counts as “armor” with an Armor Rating of 3 against natural damage.

Salvage Station.name: Salvage Station
Salvage Station.description: To be able to salvage wrecks and space junk, you will need lots of empty space, a system of derricks, some mechanized grabber arms and a good hull cutter. The salvage module can be used to salvage debris or ships up to one class below that of your own ship.

Salvage Unit.name: Salvage Unit
Salvage Unit.description: This feature enables you to salvage ships up to two classes below your that of your own ship, using a mining station.

Seasoned Travelers.name: Seasoned Travelers
Seasoned Travelers.description: You can test manipulation instead of culture to understand a group’s customs.

Security tablet.name: Security tablet
Security tablet.description: The security tablet is a codebreaker and an electronic lockpick, and it counteracts electronic and sensor-based traps. Without the tablet, all of the above is difficult to handle (-2 to technology).

Seductive.name: Seductive
Seductive.description: You have an eye for romance, and get a +2 to manipulation in situations when you try to achieve something through seduction.

Sensitive Sensors.name: Sensitive Sensors
Sensitive Sensors.description: The sensors of the ship are extremely fine-tuned. Each tier of this feature gives +1 to all sensor rolls. Can be bought up to three times.

Sensor scope.name: Sensor scope
Sensor scope.description: A passive sensor that reads the target and provides a firing reference for the shooter as a small dot of light. The scope adjusts contrast and gives information about range, wind drift and other relevant facts. Makes it easier to hit with firearms (+1 to ranged combat) at Short range and above. Requires an aimed shot (page 88).

Sensor smoke grenade.name: Sensor smoke grenade
Sensor smoke grenade.description: Same as @Item[Smoke grenade], but the smoke also blocks sensors and makes them unusable within the smoke.

Service Station.name: Service Station
Service Station.description: The service station is a non-pressurized cargo unit loaded with whatever the ship might need in terms of repairs. The module aids the engineer with repairs during travel. Crews that travel far across the stars would do well to keep a fully stocked service station on their ship. Read more in the sections Service & Maintenance (page 155) and Ship Combat (page 162).

Servo Locks.name: Servo Locks
Servo Locks.description: The joints in your arms and shoulders have been replaced with lockable servo units, enabling you to carry extremely heavy objects for short distances, and grapple people in combat very effectively. You get a +2 to melee combat when your opponent tries to break free from your grappling hold, and a +2 to force for heavy lifting.

Severed Aorta.name: Severed Aorta
Severed Aorta.description: Unconscious [[/roll d6]] hours, then -2 to dexterity.

Severed Artery (Arm).name: Severed Artery (Arm)
Severed Artery (Arm).description: Unconscious [[/roll d6]] hours, then -1 to dexterity.

Severed Artery (Leg).name: Severed Artery (Leg)
Severed Artery (Leg).description: Unconscious [[/roll d6]] hours, then -2 to dexterity.

Severed Jugular.name: Severed Jugular
Severed Jugular.description: Unconscious [[/roll d6]] hours, then -1 to dexterity.

Ship Intelligence.name: Ship Intelligence
Ship Intelligence.description: The ship’s main computer is very capable and verbal. It can perform any function on the ship with a 1 in the attribute and a 3 in the skill relevant for that function. It can perform only one function at a time, cannot replace more than one crew member at a time, and cannot help (page 58) crew members with their rolls. Some ship intelligences become eccentric over the years, acting erratically and refusing to carry out certain commands.

Ship System.name: Ship System
Ship System.description: One crew position on the ship is replaced by a dedicated computer system. The system has a 3 in both the attribute and the skill relevant to the position. More than one ship system can be installed – all crew positions can be automated except for the captain.

Shredded Ear.name: Shredded Ear
Shredded Ear.description: Stunned for one turn, then -2 to observation. Permanent ugly scar.

Signal jammer.name: Signal jammer
Signal jammer.description: Generates interference across a specific range of com frequencies, or generally across all bands. Affected coms require a successful technology test to be used despite the jamming. The jammer has Extreme Range. Powered by a @Item[Fusion battery].

Situational Awareness.name: Situational Awareness
Situational Awareness.description: You always know your surroundings, and get a +2 to observation when testing it to discover an ambush.

Skin Electrodes.name: Skin Electrodes
Skin Electrodes.description: Your palms are fitted with conductive surfaces capable of transmitting powerful electrical shocks. After a successful unarmed attack, you can choose to inflict 2 points of stress (page 92) instead of dealing damage. Each additional six rolled inflicts 1 extra point of stress.

Slow Accelerator.name: Slow Accelerator
Slow Accelerator.description: The grav projector’s accelerator unit is slow and unresponsive. When the problem is activated, moving the ship in combat costs one extra EP.

Smoke grenade.name: Smoke grenade
Smoke grenade.description: The grenade spreads thick smoke covering everything within Short Range.

Smuggler's Stash.name: Smuggler's Stash
Smuggler's Stash.description: A hidden compartment for sensitive cargo. Since the stash needs to stay hidden, most of the actual module is filled with something else – perhaps a relaxation unit or just ordinary cargo. The hidden stash can hold only 20% of the weight that a regular cargo hold can hold (above). Finding a hidden stash requires a successful observation test.

Soothing.name: Soothing
Soothing.description: You read others as if they were open books, and possess a natural quality that makes people open up to you. You get a +2 to medicurgy when treating someone who has been broken by stress (page 92).

Spare part, Advanced.name: Spare part, Advanced
Spare part, Advanced.description: Enough for one repair to Advanced technology. Advanced tools are required for the repair.

Spare part, Ordinary.name: Spare part, Ordinary
Spare part, Ordinary.description: Enough for one repair to Ordinary technology. Ordinary tools or better are required for the repair.

Spare part, Primitive.name: Spare part, Primitive
Spare part, Primitive.description: Enough for one repair to Primitive technology. Used without tools, it gives a -2 to technology.

Spider doctor.name: Spider doctor
Spider doctor.description: An autonomous field medic unit with a spider-like design. Diagnoses the patient, initiates treatment and reports to other units via a level II com if needed. Applying a spider doctor to a wounded person is a slow action, but after that it acts independently with Wits 5 and medicurgy 3. The spider has a full @Item[Trauma kit] (no bonus).

Spider suit.name: Spider suit
Spider suit.description: The suit consists of gloves, boots and pads for elbows and knees that stick to most materials, letting the wearer climb completely flat surfaces and hang upside down from the ceiling. Gives the wearer +3 to dexterity. The suit can be turned on and off.

Sprained Ankle.name: Sprained Ankle
Sprained Ankle.description: Falls down, then -1 to dexterity and infiltration.

Sprained Wrist.name: Sprained Wrist
Sprained Wrist.description: Drops held item, then -1 to ranged combat and melee combat.

Sprinter.name: Sprinter
Sprinter.description: Your Movement Rate (page 84) is increased from 10 to 12 meters. You can learn this talent up to three times, for a maximum Movement Rate of 16 meters. This talent can be combined with the @Item[Quick] talent, but not with @Item[Cybernetic Muscles].

Stasis Hold.name: Stasis Hold
Stasis Hold.description:
The stasis hold contains beds for cryogenic sleep. Without stasis, portal jumps are basically suicide, or at the very least a one-way ticket to chronic hyper madness. Stasis is sometimes also used during long interplanetary trips. Ships with a destination several jumps away usually won’t wake passengers or non-essential crew until after the final jump is completed. The number of stasis beds is determined by the class of the ship:

ClassStatis Beds
I1
II4
III16
IV64
V256

Stealth Technology.name: Stealth Technology
Stealth Technology.description: The ship is fitted with the latest in high absorbent duraceramics and zero-signature radiation shields. Gives -1 to Signature. The ship can disappear during combat (page 169).

Stop.name: Stop
Stop.description: You can stop an NPC from performing an action she otherwise would have. It must be something subtle, that can be attributed to simple forgetfulness. Typical examples would be that the NPC lets the PCs pass a roadblock without checking their papers, or forgets her keys somewhere. The power cannot be used to stop an incoming attack.

Structural Damage.name: Structural Damage
Structural Damage.description: The Armor Rating of the ship is reduced by 2, and Signature is increased by 2 until the damage is repaired.

Stun grenade.name: Stun grenade
Stun grenade.description: The grenade detonates with a loud bang and a blinding flash. Deals stress instead of damage.

Super Sensors.name: Super Sensors
Super Sensors.description: High output sensor cores, reinforced sensor chambers, and nanite membranes. Increases the sensor range to 8 Combat Units.

Supercharged reactor.name: Supercharged reactor
Supercharged reactor.description: The fuel rods in the reactor use hydrogen isotypes with higher energy output. Gives the ship +1 Energy Point.

Survival mask.name: Survival mask
Survival mask.description: Full-face mask connected to an oxygen tank. Recycles exhaled oxygen and lasts for one hour in a completely oxygen-free environment and for one day in low-oxygen surroundings. If the mask absorbs some oxygen from the surrounding atmosphere, harmful substances are filtered out.

Survival rations.name: Survival rations
Survival rations.description: Bland but nutritious. Enough for one person for one day of hard work. Add half a liter of water per meal and it will cook itself. Warm water will give a tastier meal, but cold water is also fine.

Survivors.name: Survivors
Survivors.description: You can get out of a dangerous situation somehow connected to nature, such as a brushfire or explosive decompression. The whole group escapes the danger. The GM gets 1 DP per use. One use per session for the whole group (not once per PC).

Tabak.name: Tabak
Tabak.description: Mild stimulant with a sweet taste. Rolled, dried and ground up to be smoked in a hookah. Essential oils are sometimes added for a deeper flavor. In certain parts of the Horizon, it is dried, rolled and smoked directly, or used to brew a bitter and soothing tea.

Tabula.name: Tabula
Tabula.description: A tablet that can be operated by hand or using ornate stylus pens. Everyday object used to gather information, keep a diary or just to read the Bulletin’s news.

Tag.name: Tag
Tag.description: A crystalline memory stick for information or birr. Charged at a terminal and not personal, which makes it hard to trace unless you know its specific number.

Talisman.name: Talisman
Talisman.description: Picture or symbol representing one of the Icons. Worn on the body or placed somewhere visible in a vehicle, spaceship or shop to bring good fortunes and protect against dark influences. A blessed talisman grants a +1 modifier to one dice roll (see the talent @Item[Talisman Maker]).

Talisman Maker.name: Talisman Maker
Talisman Maker.description: You know how to create and bless talismans. The process takes [[/roll d6]] hours and requires a chapel or an altar. A talisman provides a +1 to one skill test, then the blessing wears off

Targeting Scope.name: Targeting Scope
Targeting Scope.description: One of your eyes has been enhanced with a targeting scope. Makes it easier to hit with firearms (+1 to ranged combat) at Short range and above. Does not work for quick shots (page 88).

Teeth Knocked Out.name: Teeth Knocked Out
Teeth Knocked Out.description: Stunned for one turn, then -2 to manipulation.

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
Telekinesis.description: You can lift, move, turn or bend an object using sheer force of will. The item must be tiny – larger objects are beyond your control. No dice roll is needed, unless you want to use the object for something demanding like moving a key to a lock and then turning it. Then test any appropriate skill. The power cannot be used in combat.

The Dancer's Talent.name: The Dancer's Talent
The Dancer's Talent.description: You can evade an incoming attack, taking no damage. You can choose to activate the talent after a successful attack roll, but before you roll any cover or armor dice.

The Deckhand's Talent.name: The Deckhand's Talent
The Deckhand's Talent.description: If your ship drops to zero Hull Points or Energy Points, you can restore [[/roll d6]] points of either kind instantly. This requires no action from you – it is the Icons intervening on your behalf.

The Faceless One's Talent.name: The Faceless One's Talent
The Faceless One's Talent.description: Fate is on your side, giving you the benefit of getting to change a single, concrete detail in a scene more to your favor. It must be something that has a cosmetic or indirectly helpful effect – you cannot make an enemy disappear, but you can decide that there is a knife within reach, or that a window has been left open. The GM has final say on what is possible to accomplish with the talent. Remember, you can only use the talent once per session.

The Gambler's Talent.name: The Gambler's Talent
The Gambler's Talent.description: You are incredibly lucky and can choose an automatic critical success on a skill test of your choice. It counts as if you had rolled three sixes. If it is an advanced skill, you still need a level of at least 1 in that skill to activate the talent.

The Hassassin's Thrust.name: The Hassassin's Thrust
The Hassassin's Thrust.description: You are a highly trained assassin. When you make a sneak attack (page 85) using a small weapon, you get +2 to melee combat.

The Judge's Talent.name: The Judge's Talent
The Judge's Talent.description: You deal an automatic critical injury when your attack hits, regardless of whether the attack penetrated cover and armor. Any other effects from the attack are resolved as usual.

The Lady of Tears' Talent.name: The Lady of Tears' Talent
The Lady of Tears' Talent.description: You can get back up after having been broken by damage or stress, and are immediately restored to 1 HP or MP (read more in Chapter 5). Alternatively, you can choose to ignore the effects of a critical injury when you suffer one.

The Merchant's Talent.name: The Merchant's Talent
The Merchant's Talent.description: You can find a favorable loan enabling you to purchase an expensive object or a ship module. The loan must then be paid back within the agreed upon timeframe.

The Messenger's Talent.name: The Messenger's Talent
The Messenger's Talent.description: You can make someone obey you, through careful words and actions, without having to test manipulation. Can be used on both NPCs and PCs. Your wish must be reasonable, you cannot, for example, force an NPC to act completely against her own interests.

The Traveler's Talent.name: The Traveler's Talent
The Traveler's Talent.description: You can ask the GM about a choice you have to make in the game. It has to be a choice with only two options. The GM must then answer truthfully which of the two is most beneficial to you, if that is at all possible to estimate.

Thermal Cannon.name: Thermal Cannon
Thermal Cannon.description: A cannon firing rays of superheated plasma.

Thermal cutter.name: Thermal cutter
Thermal cutter.description: A @Item[Cutting torch] with a thermal lance that can cut through ship’s hulls, armored doors and similar things in one minute, creating a hole big enough for a person in an @Item[Exo shell]. Powered by three cells that must be changed after each use.

Thermal grenade.name: Thermal grenade
Thermal grenade.description: The grenade spreads a cloud of flames, setting fire to people and gear caught by the blast.

Thermobaric grenade.name: Thermobaric grenade
Thermobaric grenade.description: The grenade detonates with a powerful explosion and the shockwave spreads a big cloud of fire.

Thermostatic suit.name: Thermostatic suit
Thermostatic suit.description: A suit that monitors and chemically corrects the wearer’s body temperature. No extra energy source is necessary. Works between +70 degrees Celsius and -80 degrees Celsius. Collects the wearer’s sweat and urine, purifies it, and fills up an internal compartment with clean water. Gives a +1 to survival and supplies one ration of water per day.

Third Eye.name: Third Eye
Third Eye.description: You have the ability to sense an ambush, and once per session you can avoid the effects of being surprised. The talent also gives you a constant +2 to observation when trying to detect a sneak attack or an ambush.

Tools, Advanced.name: Tools, Advanced
Tools, Advanced.description: Multitools for all kinds of Advanced repairs as long as the proper spare parts are available. Gives a +1 to technology.

Tools, Ordinary.name: Tools, Ordinary
Tools, Ordinary.description: Multitools for all kinds of Ordinary repairs as long as the proper spare parts are available. Gives no bonus, but are necessary for the repairs.

Tools, Primitive.name: Tools, Primitive
Tools, Primitive.description: Simple tools for repairs. Spare parts are required to repair or create basic objects. Spare parts used without tools give the user a -2 to technology.

Torpedo and Mine System.name: Torpedo and Mine System
Torpedo and Mine System.description: A module for storing and firing torpedoes and mines. Can hold up to four torpedoes or eight mines (a mine counts as half a torpedo). The actual torpedoes and mines need to be purchased individually. A critical hit in the torpedo room destroys all of its torpedoes, and could be disastrous to the whole ship.

Tough.name: Tough
Tough.description: You are used to taking a beating. You get 2 additional Hit Points.

Track loader.name: Track loader
Track loader.description: A container rack platform running on tracks, between 30 and 50 meters long. There is a small driver’s cabin in the front from which the operator directs the movement of the platform. Radio beacons help the driver maneuver the enormous platform in spaceports or other industrial areas, allowing the vehicle to reach a speed of between 50 and 60 kilometers per hour, but in settlements without beacons, the top speed is about 15 kilometers per hour as manual navigation of the platform is a very delicate affair.

Transactor.name: Transactor
Transactor.description: A personal identity card that can hold birr and credit as well as other information. Since it is personal, it is easy to trace (+1 to data djinn if the tracer has access to the correct personal information).

Trauma Lab.name: Trauma Lab
Trauma Lab.description: The medlab has been upgraded to a trauma lab (see Chapter 6).

Trauma dose.name: Trauma dose
Trauma dose.description: An Advanced version of the @Item[M-dose]. One use. Preferably used together with a @Item[Trauma kit] or @Item[Trauma lab]. Used alone it gives only a +2 to medicurgy.

Trauma kit.name: Trauma kit
Trauma kit.description: An Advanced version of the @Item[Medkit]. Gives a +3 to all medicurgy rolls. Contains 10 trauma doses. Cannot be used without trauma doses.

Trauma lab.name: Trauma lab
Trauma lab.description: A state-of-the-art med unit that gives a +4 to medicurgy rolls, or a +5 when treating critical injuries. The trauma lab must be resupplied after 100 treatments, at the cost of 15,000 birr. If the supplies from the lab are taken away to be used in the field, they count as trauma doses. A trauma lab takes up space equivalent to one spaceship module.

Truth Seekers.name: Truth Seekers
Truth Seekers.description: You can find important information or get a clue from the GM without rolling dice. The information must be important enough to enable you to overcome a minor obstacle or a challenge in the scenario. The GM gets 1 DP per use. One use per session for the whole group (not once per PC).

Tuned Accelerator.name: Tuned Accelerator
Tuned Accelerator.description: The accelerator core powering the graviton projector has advanced exhaust controls and djinn intelligences for higher effect. Gives a +2 to the pilot roll for the advance/ retreat action.

Turbo Projector.name: Turbo Projector
Turbo Projector.description: The projector’s graviton coils have been reinforced. Gives +1 to Maneuverability and Speed. Can be purchased twice.

Twin carbine.name: Twin carbine
Twin carbine.description: A double barrel accelerator carbine. Both barrels fire at the same time. Has a tendency to overheat easily, and the GM only has to spend 2 DP to cause a weapon jam.

Unreliable Sensors.name: Unreliable Sensors
Unreliable Sensors.description: The sensors of the ship are of poor quality. When the problem is activated, all data djinn sensor rolls suffer a -1 during a combat encounter or some other event requiring dice rolls.

Vacuum sealer.name: Vacuum sealer
Vacuum sealer.description: The sealer looks like a big injector. It is used to seal up small holes in exos or hulls. Advanced exo shells have built-in sealers which increase their cost to twice the price of a regular sealer.

Voice Amplifier.name: Voice Amplifier
Voice Amplifier.description: A resonance chamber with built-in loudspeakers in your throat can amplify your voice. You get a +2 to command or manipulation in situations where a loud voice is a benefit, for example when intimidating someone.

Voice amplifier.name: Voice amplifier
Voice amplifier.description: The amplifier usually looks like a tube one speaks into, carrying one’s voice up to 100 meters.

Vulcan PDW.name: Vulcan PDW
Vulcan PDW.description: A hybrid between a carbine and a pistol, produced and marketed by Nestera as a “personal defense weapon”. Used by bodyguards as it is more discreet than a carbine.

Vulcan Scorpion.name: Vulcan Scorpion
Vulcan Scorpion.description: A Vulcan pistol capable of automatic fire. Popular among criminals but very difficult to handle.

Vulcan pistol Arax Omir.name: Vulcan pistol Arax Omir
Vulcan pistol Arax Omir.description: A big, heavy pistol with a nasty reputation for causing wounds that heal slowly.

Water jet.name: Water jet
Water jet.description: A water jet propulsion system worn as a backpack. Gives the wearer +1 to dexterity under water. Powered by a @Item[Cell] that lasts for two hours.

Water purifier.name: Water purifier
Water purifier.description: Purifies water from toxins and chemicals as well as biological and radioactive threats. Can purify enough water for one person per day. Powered by a @Item[Cell] that needs changing once a week.

Wealthy Family.name: Wealthy Family
Wealthy Family.description: You can use the rumors of your family’s vast riches to give yourself a +2 to manipulation in any situation where the GM deems it relevant. Whether the rumors are true or not doesn’t matter. You can only choose this talent if you come from a Privileged background (page 21).

Weapon System.name: Weapon System
Weapon System.description: Weapon systems are not bought like other modules. Each system is a separate module, with its own cost in birr – see table 7.9. Torpedoes and mines are not a weapons system as such. They require a torpedo and mine system, and each torpedo/mine needs to be purchased separately.

Weatherproof.name: Weatherproof
Weatherproof.description: You are heavily modified to withstand all climates, recycle body fluids and conserve energy. The effect of this is that the time between each point of damage you suffer from thirst or hunger (page 98) is doubled – to 24 hours and 4 days, respectively.

Workshop.name: Workshop
Workshop.description: This module is a complete workshop for making repairs onboard. The module gives a +1 to all technology rolls, including repairs of the ship itself. The workshop can only be used for repairs of up to Ordinary level equipment (but see the feature Advanced Workshop).

Workshop, Advanced.name: Workshop, Advanced
Workshop, Advanced.description: Gives a +2 to all technology rolls. Contains spare parts for 10 Advanced repairs. Resupplying the workshop costs 2,000 birr.

Workshop, Ordinary.name: Workshop, Ordinary
Workshop, Ordinary.description: Enables repairs and construction of basic Ordinary items. Gives a +1 to technology. Contains spare parts for 10 Ordinary repairs. Resupplying the workshop costs 500 birr.

Workshop, Primitive.name: Workshop, Primitive
Workshop, Primitive.description: Gives a +1 to all technology rolls when repairing Primitive technology. Contains spare parts for 10 Primitive repairs. Resupplying the workshop costs 100 birr.

Worn-out Ship Computer.name: Worn-out Ship Computer
Worn-out Ship Computer.description: The ship’s computer has seen better days. When the problem is activated, all pilot rolls suffer a -1 during a fight or some other event requiring dice rolls.

Zero-G Training.name: Zero-G Training
Zero-G Training.description: Your sense of balance is well adapted to an environment without gravity. You get a +2 to dexterity when in zero-G.
